author: TimesReporter.com staff report
title: T-R college notebook for Oct. 8
text: Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 1:15 AM By TimesReporter.com staff report Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 1:15 AM Cregan, Kent receive academic awards Nicolette Cregan (Strasburg) is a member of the Kent State softball team that was recognized by the National Fastpitch Coaches Association (NFCA) for its academic excellence during the 2014-15 academic year, as 13 Golden Flashes earned NFCA All-America Scholar-Athlete honors. Cregan, a junior, was a first-time recipient for the Golden Flashes. She appeared in two games last season and collected her first collegiate hit and an RBI against Rider. The NFCA is expected to release its team GPA rankings next week. Kent State ranked 18th for the 2013-14 academic year and has earned a top-20 GPA in each of the three previous years. Dodd to wrestle at West Liberty Tyler Dodd (Carrollton) will wrestle at West Liberty this season. Dodd is a freshman multi-sport athlete who also plays football at West Liberty. A three-time Ohio Division II state qualifier, Dodd was regarded as one of the top prep wrestlers in Ohio. He went 51-1 as a senior with only loss coming in the 220-pound state championship match in overtime. By TimesReporter.com staff report
